msDesc.head: 'Rosa pisanella' (Bartolomeo da San Concordio, Summa de casibus conscientiae), Italy, 1452

msItem.author: Bartolomeo da San Concordio of Pisa
msItem.title: Summa de casibus conscientiae
msItem.rubric: Rosa Pisanella (heading written by scribe on fol. 1)
msItem.note: The Summa de Casibus Conscientiae of Fra Bartolomeo da San Concordio of Pisa, with a collection of additional extracts on the virtues and vices later added in the margins.
msItem.incipit: (fol. 1ra) Quoniam ut ait Gregorius super Ezechielem
(fol. 1rb) Abbas in suo monasterio conferre potest
msItem.explicit: (fol. 299va) (Zelus) ut dictum est supra Invidia § II.
msItem.note: There are extra passages in the text, generally marked by 'additio' in red. Following the text are:
An index of the headings: Abbas-Zelus

msItem.rubric: Iste sunt declarationes de abreviaturis in hac summa positis
msItem.explicit: (fol. 303ra) §peragrafus. Sunt et alie abreviature ... probacionem ponitur.

msItem.note: A reply to those who say that this Summa seems shorter than the Summa Confessorum
msItem.incipit: Quesisti karissime cum dixerim in prologo

msItem.note: A description of the contents of the Decretals
msItem.incipit: Liber Decretorum distinguitur in tres partes

msItem.colophon: Consumatum fuit hoc opus in civitate Pisana per fratrem Bartholomeum de Sancta Concordia eiusdem civitatis ordinis predicatorum. Anno domini millesimo tricesimo octavo de mense Septembris [corrected from Decembris, the date usually found]. tempore Benedicti pp. duodecimi. Scriptum et completum sub Anno domini M°CCCC°Lij°. die vero xiij Mensis Septembris.

msItem.note: Addition made by the same scribe
msItem.incipit: Quoniam ut ait Gregorius Ieronimus varia sanctarum scripturarum poma sunt decerpenda et hiis quasi deliciis perfruenda. Ideo ad laudem dei et consolationem novitiorum et pauperum fratrum tam de textu biblie quam de sanctorum et philosophorum dictis aliquas notabiles auctoritates sicut delicata et electa poma de arbore et rosas odoriferas et delectabiles de rosario diligenter collegi, et in presenti libello sub certis et determinatis rubris tam de virtutibus quam de viciis solicite scribere procuravi quatenus legentes in eo sint devoti in mente, copiosi in verbo, ordinati in moribus, cauti a viciis et in cunctis virtutibus et bonis operibus studiosi

msItem.note: Addition made by the same scribe
msItem.incipit: Sequitur tabula et ordinabis isto modo. De fide catholica-lxii°. etc.
msItem.note: This is an index to the alphabetical series of extracts added by the scribe in the margins of the MS. after it had been rubricated. Most of fol. 304 is blank.

extent.seg: vi + 309 leaves (fol. 216 is double, fol. i-vi, 305-8 are flyleaves)

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in red and blue roman numerals by the scribe.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 43 lines, apparently ruled in pale ink

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials blue or red flourished in red or violet. (Pächt and Alexander ii. list, p. 105)

binding.p: English diced russia binding, c. 1800, rebacked.

history.provenance: The MS. once belonged to a Spaniard: on fol. 304 are the notes, in a later hand: 'Tiene ojas ccc' and 'La tabla tiene 9 paginas'.
Sir Thomas Phillipps, -1872: Phillipps MS. 9239. Sold Sotheby's June 1896, lot 302.
James P. R. Lyell, 1871–1948: bought by Lyell in October 1937.
history.acquisition: Chosen as one of the hundred manuscripts bequeathed to the Bodleian by Lyell in 1948.
